title: Heavy floods in DR Congo’s Kinshasa leave dozens dead, destroy homes
snippets: The capital struggles as the Ndjili River overflows, leaving drivers stranded, and infrastructure collapses.

titles: Heavy floods in DR Congo’s Kinshasa leave dozens dead, destroy homes

titles: US stock futures tumble as officials offer no respite from tariffs

title: Britain to dilute rules for smaller private equity firms and hedge funds
snippets: UK government proposes lifting regulation threshold from £100mn of funds under management to £5bn
summary: The UK government has proposed raising the regulation threshold for funds under management from £100 million to £5 billion. This change aims to adjust the regulatory framework, potentially affecting the oversight and management of investment funds within the UK financial sector.
titles: Britain to dilute rules for smaller private equity firms and hedge funds

title: Trump officials vow to stay the course on tariffs despite market turmoil
snippets: Treasury secretary rejects recession fears and says tough ‘reciprocal’ levies will not be delayed
summary: The Treasury Secretary has dismissed concerns about a potential recession and stated that the implementation of stringent 'reciprocal' tariffs will proceed without delay. This position indicates a commitment to maintaining the planned economic measures despite worries about their impact on economic stability.
titles: Trump officials vow to stay the course on tariffs despite market turmoil

title: EV targets watered down to help tariff-hit UK car industry
snippets: New rules will allow manufacturers to sell full hybrid and plug-in hybrid vehicles until 2035
summary: New regulations have been introduced permitting the sale of full hybrid and plug-in hybrid vehicles up until the year 2035. This decision extends the availability of these types of vehicles, aligning with evolving automotive and environmental standards.
titles: EV targets watered down to help tariff-hit UK car industry

title: Big investors look to sell out of private equity after market rout
snippets: Pensions and endowments seek exit from battered portfolios in blow to buyout industry
summary: Pensions and endowments are attempting to sell off their investments in private equity and other alternative assets, due to poor performance. This trend is negatively affecting the buyout industry, as these institutional investors are a significant source of capital for private equity firms. The move to exit these investments reflects broader concerns about the current state and future outlook of the buyout sector.
titles: Big investors look to sell out of private equity after market rout
